pros: Great team, good management and good experiences
cons: Hours are not always desirable

pros: Its pretty easy and good money for what I was doing

pros: Alignment with the mission of the organization
cons: Micro manage staff Does not empower staff

review_title: Great company, nonprofit so may be a lot of work at time
pros: Work culture and Management Everyone cares
cons: Pay can seem a little low

pros: Great for flexibility, days off, perks, great internship and career exploration opportunities for students. CEO is a great person, cares about the staff, is personable and means well. Would recommend applying to certain positions within the company.
cons: Opportunity for advancement is based on who you're friends with, program managers (of summer job program) do not understand the culture of the community, do not respect or value the employees that have more personal experience and professional knowledge than them. CMs are utilized for grunt work, paper pushing. Unorganized, poor planning, poor communication, inappropriate expectations, disparate treatment, goal posts changes regularly, micromanagement, numerous ethics and privacy violations. Changes job description to force extra work, refuses to accommodate in-person interactions with participants even with social distancing and Covid guidelines.

pros: Great relationships with kids and immediate supervisor
cons: Immediate supervisor’s supervisor was completely useless. Fine with being mediocre and status quo

pros: There’s a budget for professional development Opportunities and it’s encouraged
cons: Staff is Overworked and salary is low

review_title: Great place to work- Leadership empowers you
pros:
I came to Y.O.U. with just over 20 years experience in various fields. From day one I felt empowered to lead, make my own decisions and bring my own ideas to the table. 
Leadership works hard to make sure that the staff has the tools they need to succeed and even better their work with participants is always top of mind.
cons: I do not think this is a con AT ALL, however it is a very busy and fast paced environment. This is an organization that serves people in economically distressed neighborhoods by providing workforce development opportunities. There is always something that needs to be done.

review_title: A Great Organization with Dedicated Leadership
pros:
Organization's Leadership listens to employees concerns and feedback to make timely, beneficial improvements to the company.
Team Leads provide and promote opportunities for growth, and they trust their employees to do their best work.
cons: Some departments are more siloed due to the nature of their work, but there are plenty of opportunities for interaction and engagement with other departments through various work/social functions.

review_title: Mission-driven work drives love for the organization
job_title: Vice President, Development & Communications in Cleveland, OH
pros: My coworkers are amazing and deeply committed to serving teens and young adults in Northeast Ohio. We make a real difference in their lives, so that drives the work I do on a daily basis. In addition to doing something that matters, I appreciate the flexible work schedule, the benefits, and the recognition by management that family comes first.
cons: I miss not being able to work in person with my colleagues.

pros: The best fun times ever
cons: Pay was not that good

pros: It's a job with little benefits
cons:
Low salaries for any job that's not upper management 
They have a person working there who has issues with African Americans and poor people
There are cliques in the agency and everyone gossips about everyone
If you are a robot you will move up quickly in the agency
Question if the agency is really helping the youth long term and not just putting a bandaid on the problem
Poor leadership by upper management

pros: Y.O.U. invests in their employees like they do their youth participants. Everyone is seen and valued.
cons: High turnover rate. Not speaking to Y.O.U.'s practices but feels like the nature of non-profit work in CLE.

pros: Are invested in developing your career.
cons: Sometimes difficult to work from home.

review_title: great company, a pleasure to work for
pros: -people there are excellent, so helpful, so accomodating, 12/10 experiance
cons: -you may have to grind a bit but its so very worth it!

review_title: Continuously improving for stronger community impact
pros:
Investing resources to support employees
flexible schedule
extensive employee development program
recent changes have decreased toxic behavior

job_title: Anonymous Employee in New York, NY
pros: Flexible, vacation, shutdown for winter break
cons: Poor management, no support, don’t care about the staff

pros: They have great mission and culture
cons: There is Low salary and little progression

job_title: Youth Summer Job Coach in Cleveland, OH
pros:
This position is obtained through a staffing company. It's a great job for teachers or other people who work during the school year and want a job over the summer. There were three parts to this job, signing people up for TANF, orientation for the youth and finally job coaching. 

During the job coaching portion of the job, you get to create your own schedule which is a huge plus.
cons:
The nonprofit as a whole is incredibly disorganized to the detriment of this department. The management treated the summer job coaches like second-rate workers. Training was non-existent. The company as a whole wasted our time making us sit in a room waiting for training that didn't happen. 

This job has you constantly working with people from a difficult population which can cause burnout.

pros: Typically a friendly workplace, there is flexibility in your work hours if you work directly with the summer jobs program. The summer jobs program is a good summer time position for former or current teachers.
cons: Company leadership is unorganized. Better horizontal communication would lead to better employee organization. Staff was often left to scramble and make the best out of situations.

pros: Being a part of making changes in youths' lives by assisting them with real-world work experiences that will enhance their ability to be competitive in the market place.
cons: The summer program is very chaotic; the lack of basic standardization and organization impacts the summer staff in many ways.  Ultimately they disrupt the level of positive experiences for the youth and summer staff.  Leadership during the summer program is often hot and cold, causing unnecessary stress and distractions.

pros:
Not many when you add up long hours
Low pay and lack if loyalty by organization towards its employees
cons: Low pay long hours

pros: A great experience if interested in direct service work with inner-city & vulnerable populations; Would strongly encourage recent graduates and/or current students to try to get involved in summer or workforce development programs. Senior management has good intentions with organizational direction and policy.
cons: Pay is low even for the industry and the majority of non-senior managers have at least one other job; Senior management's good intentions fall flat due to incompetent execution of complex strategies; Poor communication across departments, staff on-boarding is vague and often misleading, leading to high turnover rates.

pros:
They do great work in the community. 
Flexible schedule with your managers approval (flexing time)
cons: A lot of employees are incompetent and under qualified which makes it difficult when working in teams. They don’t pay a competitive wage. They keep management in place when they’re toxic to the culture and have force good talent away. Outdated practices. Huge pay disparity between senior management and regular employees.

pros: If you've never had a job before, this is a great start. I worked through them for 3 years. I've never felt more ready
cons: If you work over your assigned hours, you only get paid for the assigned hours. Pay isn't that bad if you know to manage your money.

review_title: 2 years "summer" first Job was at almira middle School we was cleaning and maintenance. Second job was child care.

cons: Time management and work ethics
